1.text: My son, if thou receivest my words, and layest up my commandments with thee,

2.text: so that thou incline thine ear unto wisdom [and] thou apply thy heart to understanding;

3.text: yea, if thou criest after discernment [and] liftest up thy voice to understanding;

4.text: if thou seekest her as silver and searchest for her as for hidden treasures:

5.text: then shalt thou understand the fear of Jehovah, and find the knowledge of God.

6.text: For Jehovah giveth wisdom; out of his mouth [come] knowledge and understanding.

7.text: He layeth up sound wisdom for the upright; [he] is a shield to them that walk in integrity;

8.text: guarding the paths of just judgment and keeping the way of his godly ones.

9.text: Then shalt thou understand righteousness and judgment and equity: every good path.

10.text: When wisdom entereth into thy heart and knowledge is pleasant unto thy soul,

11.text: discretion shall keep thee, understanding shall preserve thee:

12.text: To deliver thee from the way of evil, from the man that speaketh froward things;

13.text: [from those] who leave the paths of uprightness, to walk in the ways of darkness;

14.text: who rejoice to do evil, [and] delight in the frowardness of evil;

15.text: whose paths are crooked, and who are perverted in their course:

16.text: To deliver thee from the strange woman, from the stranger who flattereth with her words;

17.text: who forsaketh the guide of her youth, and forgetteth the covenant of her God;

18.text: â€”for her house inclineth unto death, and her paths unto the dead;

19.text: none that go unto her return again, neither do they attain to the paths of life:

20.text: that thou mayest walk in the way of the good, And keep the paths of the righteous.

21.text: For the upright shall dwell in the land, and the perfect shall remain in it;

22.text: but the wicked shall be cut off from the land, and the unfaithful shall be plucked up out of it.
